com.aeonium.javafx.validation

Class ValidatorService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aeonium.javafx.validation.ValidatorService

  • public class ValidatorService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a registry for validator objects and provides methods for looking up validators of a control.
    Author:
    Robert Rohm <r.rohm@aeonium-systems.de>

      • createActionManager

        public static com.aeonium.javafx.actions.FXActionManager createActionManager()
        Use this factory method to obtain an instance of the FXActionManager as a callback for loading an initializing FXML UIs. Main purpose of this factory method is to initialize the FXActionManager with the default handlers for the validatio annotations. If you need to create custom annotations and/or custom handlers, add the handlers in the way this method does: 
            FXActionManager fxActionManager = new FXActionManager();
    fxActionManager.addHandler(FXRequired.class, new DefaultFXValidationHandler1());
    fxActionManager.addHandler(FXString.class, new DefaultFXValidationHandler1());
    fxActionManager.addHandler(FXNumber.class, new DefaultFXValidationHandler1());
    fxActionManager.addHandler(FXNotNull.class, new DefaultFXValidationHandler1());
    fxActionManager.addHandler(FXValidationChecked.class, new DefaultFXValidationCheckedHandler());
        Returns:
        The newly created and initialized action manager.

      • initializeActionManager

        public static void initializeActionManager(com.aeonium.javafx.actions.FXActionManager fxActionManager)
        Use this method if you have already an instance of FXActionManager and you want to initialize it for using aeFXValidation annotations.
        Parameters:
        fxActionManager - The action manager instance

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(javafx.scene.Parent parent,
                              java.lang.Object controller)
        The convenient way to initialize the node tree and the controller. This method does actually the same like: 
        
      FXActionManager actionManager = ValidatorService.createActionManager();

      LabelService.initialize(parent);
      actionManager.initActions(controller);
      ValidatorService.initialize(controller);
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node to scan the tree down from.
        controller - The controller to initialize.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.lang.Object controller)
        Initialize validation in the given controller object.
        Parameters:
        controller - The controller to initialize

      • initializeCheckedControls

        private static void initializeCheckedControls(java.util.List<javafx.scene.control.Control> checkedControls,
                                              java.util.List<javafx.scene.control.Control> validatedControls)
                                       throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Iterate through a list of "checked" controls, i.e., of controls that have to be controlled by the validation service: their disable property gets bound to the combined result of all validation constraints.
        Parameters:
        checkedControls - The list of checked controls
        validatedControls - The list of validated controls
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if control is not an instance of ButtonBase

      • initializeCheckedProperties

        private static void initializeCheckedProperties(java.util.List<javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty> checkedProperties,
                                                java.util.List<javafx.scene.control.Control> validatedControls)
        Initialize checked boolean properties, i.e., bind their value to the combined result of all validation constraints.
        Parameters:
        checkedProperties - The list of checked properties
        validatedControls - The list of validated controles

      • validate

        public static void validate(java.lang.Object controller)
                     throws ValidationException
        Process all validators that belong to the given controller - this is failfast, the method quits validation on the first failure with an exception.
        Parameters:
        controller - The controller
        Throws:
        ValidationException - The Exception signalling a failed validation
